abstract: Chicago City Council agrees to pay $5 million to family of Laquan McDonald, black teenager who was fatally shot by city police officer in 2014; unanimous decision arrives swiftly, before family had time to file civil case; settlement comes amid increased scrutiny of such shootings across nation.
lead_paragraph: The City Council’s decision came swiftly and with no debate, amid a flurry of new attention on police misconduct in Chicago.

headline.main: Chicago Pays $5 Million to Family of Black Teenager Killed by Officer
headline.print_headline: Chicago Pays $5 Million Over Killing of Teenager

snippet: The City Council’s decision came swiftly and with no debate, amid a flurry of new attention on police misconduct in Chicago.
